page.title: 08ST.MARY'S CHURCH, FREELAND
page.content: The church is about 100 years old built 1869). We entered under the lych gate which is for resting the coffin when it's raining. In the graveyard there were a lot of graves and we looked at those of the Taunton family, local landowners who gave money to build the church and school. These graves are nearest the church. There is also a war memorial. The windows look dull from outside but inside we saw that the windows were stained glass. The inside is very colourful as there are also a lot of wall paintings. In the vestry we saw photographs of all the vicars since 1888, and on the wall near the door is a list of vicars since the foundation of the church. There is also near the door a memorial to Lt.Taunton who died fighting in the 1st World War.
